metadata.feature_description: Filter activity stream by various criteria and activity types

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Filter by activity type using dropdown

steps.action: Navigate to Community page with Activity Stream
steps.expected: Activity Stream page loads with filter dropdown visible
steps.actual: Activity Stream page loaded with 'Filter by activity' dropdown visible

steps.action: Select 'Added to Wiki' from the activity type dropdown
steps.expected: Activity stream should filter to show only wiki-related activities
steps.actual: Dropdown changed to 'Added to Wiki' - filtering applied

steps.action: Verify filtered content shows only wiki articles
steps.expected: Stream displays only 'authored wiki article' entries
steps.actual: Stream correctly filtered to show only wiki article entries

steps.action: Select 'Filter by activity' (default option) from dropdown to reset filter
steps.expected: Activity stream should return to showing all activity types
steps.actual: Stream reset to display all activity types including photos, wiki articles, etc.

steps.action: Click on 'Photos and Wiki Filter' in the Activity Stream Filter section
steps.expected: Activity stream should filter to show only photos and wiki entries
steps.actual: Stream filtered to show photos and wiki article entries based on saved filter criteria

steps.action: Click 'Create New Feed' link in Activity Stream Filter section
steps.expected: Custom Feed Builder dialog should open
steps.actual: Custom Feed Builder dialog opened with empty form

steps.action: Enter 'Test Filter - Posts and Blogs' as Feed Name and select Posts and Blogs activity types
steps.actual: Feed Name entered and activity types selected (Blogs checkbox visible as checked)

steps.expected: New filter should be created and appear in filter list
steps.actual: Filter saved successfully and 'Test Filter - Posts and Blogs' appeared in the Activity Stream Filter list

steps.action: Hover over 'Test Filter - Posts and Blogs' filter to reveal edit icon and click it
steps.expected: Edit dialog should open with filter data pre-populated
steps.actual: Custom Feed Builder dialog opened with 'Test Filter - Posts and Blogs' pre-populated in Feed Name field, Cancel/Delete/Update buttons visible

steps.action: Modify filter name to 'Test Filter - Posts and Blogs (Edited)' and click Update
steps.expected: Filter should be updated with new name
steps.actual: Filter updated successfully and list shows 'Test Filter - Posts and Blogs (Edited)'

steps.action: Hover over edited filter and click edit icon to open dialog
steps.expected: Edit dialog should open with Delete button available
steps.actual: Dialog opened showing Cancel, Delete (red), and Update buttons

steps.expected: Filter should be removed from the list
steps.actual: Filter deleted successfully - list now only shows 'Photos and Wiki Filter' and 'Test User Filter'

observations: The Activity Stream filtering system provides two filtering mechanisms: (1) a quick filter dropdown for single activity type filtering, and (2) a saved custom filters feature for complex multi-criteria filtering.
Custom filters support filtering by: Activity Authors (users), Activity Groups, and Activity Types (journal types).
The suggested test scenario 'Filter by date range' is not available in the UI - code review confirms the FilterBuilder only supports user, group, and journalType filter criteria, not date ranges.

The 'Filter by user' and 'Filter by group' scenarios are implemented through the custom filter creation feature via Activity Authors and Activity Groups fields, rather than as separate standalone filters.

Filter persistence across sessions was not explicitly tested as it requires logout/login cycle, but the saved filters are stored in the database (via SaveFilter/UpdateFilter/DeleteFilter API endpoints) and should persist.
The 'Apply multiple filters' scenario is supported through custom filters which can combine multiple criteria (users, groups, activity types) in a single saved filter.
